title: Provides for a one-time 6 month stay of the enforcement of a child support order, when the payor is involuntarily terminated from employment
summary: Provides for a one-time 6 month stay of the enforcement of a child support order, when the payor is involuntarily terminated from employment; provides payor must petition the family court for such a stay within 30 days of the termination of employment; requires payment of affordable child support during the period of the stay and that child support obligations will resume after end of stay; requires payor to participate in job training and placement programs.

       AN ACT to amend the general obligations law, the family court  act,  the
         domestic  relations  law  and  the social services law, in relation to

         had  his or her employment terminated, with a temporary stay of crimi-

   18  EMPLOYMENT. 1. ANY PERSON UNDER AN OBLIGATION TO PAY CHILD SUPPORT,  WHO
   19  INVOLUNTARILY  HAS  HIS OR HER EMPLOYMENT TERMINATED, MAY, WITHIN THIRTY
   20  DAYS OF SUCH INVOLUNTARY TERMINATION OF EMPLOYMENT, PETITION  THE  COURT
   21  FOR A STAY OF THE ENFORCEMENT OF THE OBLIGATION TO PAY CHILD SUPPORT AND
